meanings.definition: To assign a task or duty to someone outside of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The teacher outasked the students with homework over the weekend.
meanings.sent2: She always outasks her brother to take out the trash.
meanings.sent3: The cat outasked the dog to guard the house while she napped.
meanings.sent4: The new employee outasked the experienced ones with a challenging project.
meanings.sent5: The superhero outasked the villain to protect the city from harm.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in terms of tasks or responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: The ambitious intern outasked her colleagues by completing all her assignments early.
meanings.sent2: He outasked his own expectations by finishing the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The robot outasked the humans in efficiency, never needing a break.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner outasked his previous record by several minutes.
meanings.sent5: The student outasked the teacher in solving the complex math problem.
